bibl.title: Military Orders for Walter Reed, William H. Forwood, and Julian M. Cabell, March 28, 1895

div1.p: Sternberg asks for a Board of Medical Officers consisting of Forwood, Reed, and Cabell to examine officers for promotion, March 28, 1895. The special order approving the request is dated March 30, 1895. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Walter Reed, William H. Forwood, and Julian M. Cabell, March 28, 1895
div1.opener:
All official communications to this Office should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
SUBJECT: Examining Board.
In reply refer to No.
War Department,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, March 28, 1895.
To the
ADJUTANT GENERAL OF THE ARMY.
Sir:-
div1.p:
I have the honor to recommend that a Board of Medical Officers
be ordered to convene at the Army Medical Museum Building in this city, on
Wednesday May 1st, 1895, at 10 A.M., for the examination of such medical of-
ficers for promotion as may be ordered before it.
Detail for the Board:

Lieutenant Colonel William H. Forwood, Deputy Surgeon General U. S. Army,
Soldiers' Home, Washington, D. C.

Major Walter Reed, Surgeon, U. S. Army, Surgeon General's Office, Wash-
ington, D. C.

Captain Julian M. Cabell, Assistant Surgeon U. S. Army, Washington Bar-
racks, Washington, D. C.

I have also to recommend that 1st Lieutenant Frank R. Keefer,
Assistant Surgeon U. S. Army, now on duty at Washington Barracks, Wash-
ington, D. C., and 1st Lieutenant Ashton B. Heyl, Assistant Surgeon U.
S. Army, now on duty at Fort Thomas, Kentucky, be directed to appear be-
fore this Board for examination for promotion, and upon the completion
of the examination to return to their proper stations.
div1.closer: Very respectfully, Geo. M. Sternberg Surgeon General, U. S. Army.

div1.head: Special Orders, No. 75, March 30, 1895
div1.p:
SPECIAL ORDERS, }
NO. 75. }

HEADQUARTERS OF THE ARMY,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, March 30, 1895.
Extract.

11. By direction of the Secretary of War, a board of officers
is appointed to meet at the Army Medical Museum Building in
this city, on Wednesday, May 1, 1895, at 10 o'clock a. m., for
the examination of such officers of the Medical Department as
may be ordered before it, to determine their fitness for promo-
tion:
Detail for the board.

Lieutenant-Colonel William H. Forwood, Deputy Surgeon-
General;
Major Walter Reed, Surgeon;
Captain Julian M. Cabell, Assistant Surgeon.
The junior member will act as recorder.

The professional examinations will be conducted under spe-
cial instructions from the Surgeon-General, through whom the
reports of the board will be forwarded to the Adjutant General
of the Army.

12. By direction of the Secretary of War, the following-
named officers will report in person to Lieutenant-Colonel Will-
iam H. Forwood, Deputy Surgeon-General, president of the ex-
amining board appointed to meet at the Army Medical Museum
Building, in this city, on Wednesday, May 1, 1895, by Special
Orders, No. 75, March 30, 1895, from this office, at such time as
they may be required by the board, for examination as to their
fitness for promotion, and upon the conclusion of their exami-
nations will return to their proper stations:
1st Lieutenant Frank R. Keefer, Assistant Surgeon;
1st Lieutenant Ashton B. Heyl, Assistant Surgeon.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

BY COMMAND OF LIEUTENANT-GENERAL SCHOFIELD:
GEO. D. RUGGLES,
Adjutant General.
